critique: This executive order pertains to the observance of holidays by government agencies and amends a previous executive order (10358). It primarily deals with how holidays are treated for full-time employees with irregular work schedules, specifying how the head of the department should designate the holiday and how it affects the employee's 40-hour workweek. There is no apparent ideological tilt, immigration aspect, expansion of executive power, federalism implication, national security concern, or social inclusion issue. The only area where it has a slight impact is economic regulation, as it clarifies how employees are compensated for holidays, but the impact is minimal.
